intro: Lepicystis piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Lepicystis piloselloides is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
